summary.p: Collection of fragments from the Bliss & Phillipps collections.
The fragments are arranged as follows:
(fols. 1–21) fragments from books probably bound at Oxford (also probably from Oxford bindings are C.m, y, z, and MS. Lat. misc. d. 13 (30572) fols. 1–2);

musicNotation.p: Notation on staves; neums (see van Dijk 1957).

history.acquisition: Bought 1953. Another fragment bought with tese is now MS. Lat. misc. d. 13 (30572), fols. 1–2.

recordHist.source: Typescript description by Bodleian library staff.

listBibl.head: Printed descriptions:
listBibl.bibl: S. J. P. van Dijk, Latin Liturgical Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, Oxford, vol. 5: Fragments - Mass Books (typescript, 1957), pp. 33, 126, 138, 170, 172, 216, 222, 240, 241, 244, 246

S. J. P. van Dijk, Latin Liturgical Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, Oxford, vol. 6: Fragments - Office Books, Rituals, Directories (typescript, 1957), pp. 14, 22, 28, 41, 89, 110, 152, 153, 158, 170, 186, 230, 232, 234, 235, 247, 266, 281, 292, 293, 331, 353

msItem.title: Vita S. Milburge virginis
msItem.note: (as in Gotha MS. I 81 fol.166v–175, see Analecta Bollandiana 58, 1940, 99–100, and Lincoln Cath. MS. 149 fol. 83v)

msItem.rubric: Prologus Domni atonis hostiensis episcopi cardinalis in miraculis inventionis sancte milburge virginis
msItem.note: Edited from Lincoln Cath. MS. 149, fol. 87r-89v by P. A. Hayward in English Historical Review 114 (1999) 543–73 (563–73)

supportDesc.extent:
Lower part of leaf, the rest of which is MS. Rawl. Q. b. 4 fol.7v-r; see also Christ Church Muniments MS. X (1). c. 1 (noted Bodl. Lib. Rec. 5 (1954–6), 109. 370 285
280 185

history.provenance: Part of the cover of a Merton College business book ‘Anno 1o Regin. Mariae ad an. 27m. Regin Elizab. A.D. 1585’
‘Henricus Savile’ (d. 1622)

msItem.title: Historia monachorum in Aegypto
msItem.note: tr. Rufinus, VII.151–3 pr. PL. 21.416 A 3 – 417 D.5

msItem.author: Gregory I
msItem.title: Moralia
msItem.note: IX.84–96 marked 20 i – 23 m, with lemmata in green and red, pr. PL. 75.904 D.3 – 912 B.5

msItem.author: Aristotle
msItem.title: Topica
msItem.note: VIII.155 a.39 – 156 b.11 transl. Boethius pr.PL.64.1000 A.7 – 1002 A.5, one leaf from the same manuscript as MS. Magd. Coll. 271 nos.16–17. Ker Pastedowns no.165

history.provenance: a pastedown from Magd. Coll. C.7.13

msItem.title: Treatise on Consequentiae (part) and some Quaestiones on universals, contingents etc.

msItem.author: Bartholomaeus Anglicus
msItem.title: De proprietatibus rerum
msItem.note: XV.118–126 pr. Nuremburg 1519

history.provenance: Labelled by Bliss ‘Philip Bliss from A. Moir’

msItem.author: Aegidius Romanus
msItem.title: Quodlibet
msItem.note: II quest.10–12, pr. Venice 1504 fol.18 col.2 1.26 - fol.19 col.2 1 line from end

msItem.author: Jerome
msItem.title: Ep. 53
msItem.note: 1.3–4, 4.1–5.1, pr. ed. I Hilberg, Vienna 1910 (CSEL. LIV 444.5–13, 449.14–451.1) with commentary probably by Guilelmus Brito

msItem.author: Gescelinus de Cassanis
msItem.title: Apparatus super Clementinas
msItem.note: III 7.2–8.1 as in MS. New Coll. 180 fol.93r col.1–94r col.1

history.provenance: Labelled by Bliss ‘from a Catullus of Dr. Bentleys - P. Bliss from A. Moir 1805’ (cf.item C.m)

msItem.note: End of a work on Spes
Beginning of a text
msItem.incipit: Sine intermissione orare, duobus modis mihi videtur fieri posse

msItem.author: Henricus de Segusio (Hostiensis)
msItem.title: Lectura super Decretales sive Apparatus in libros Decretalium
msItem.note: Prologue, pr. Venice 1581, beg. fol.3 col. 1 - fol.4v col.1 § 39

msItem.title: Summary of Thomas Aquinas, Summa Theologiae
msItem.note: part: IIa IIae 64.1–66.6, 77.2–78.1, pr. Turin, 1948

msPart.head: Kept as MS. Lat. misc. a. 2, fol.25

msItem.author: Johannes Duns Scotus
msItem.title: Quaestiones in libros Sententiarum
msItem.note: III dist. 1 quest. 1, pr. Lyons 1639 vol.7 scholia pp.10–16

msItem.title: Apocalypse
msItem.note: 22.13-end with contemporary notes. See N. R. Ker, Pastedowns in Oxford bindings, no. 403 n. 3

msItem.title: Liber Sapientie
msItem.note: I.1–14, with prologue (Isidorus, Etymologiae VI.ii.30 = Berger no. 142)

history.provenance: Used as the cover of Christopher Carlile, A discourse wherein is plainly proved that Peter was never at Rome, 1572

msItem.title: Romans, glossed
msItem.note: (1.1–8, with commentary of Gilbert de la Porrée)

decoDesc.decoNote: Fine initial. (Pächt and Alexander i. 279, pl. XIX) Decorative initial in gold, blue, red, mauve, white edged with green.

history.provenance: 14th cent. note ‘de Camberone’ (the Cistercian abbey of Cambron, Belgium)

msItem.title: Epistle to Hebrews
msItem.note: 13.17-end; with commentary of Peter Lombard, pr. PL. 192.517 A.12 – 520 A.5

msItem.author: Alan of Farfa
msItem.title: Homiliary
msItem.note: Parts of sermons 86 (= Augustine, Tractatus in Johannis evangelium 51.3–8, pr. PL. 35.1765.3 – 1766.42) and 87 (= Jerome, Commentarium in Matthaeum 21.1, pr. PL. 26. 146 B.3 – C.1)

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: De civitate dei
msItem.note: II 24–5, III 20–21, pr. ed. E. Hoffmann, Vienna 1900 (CSEL 40), parts of pp. 98 line 3 – 101 line 13, 145 line 9 – 148 line 17

msItem.author: Ambrose
msItem.title: Expositio psalmi CXVIII
msItem.note: 13.2.2–3, 3.2, pr. ed. M. Petschenig, Vienna 1913 (CSEL LXII)

msItem.title: Poem
msItem.note: (part of a poem in elegiac couplets about Bernardus)

msItem.author: Petrus Lombardus
msItem.title: Sententiae
msItem.note: IV.17.1–3, pr. Quaracchi 1916, II. 847–52; with commentary added in 15th. cent. Ker, op. cit., 1763 n. 1

msItem.author: Peter Lombardu
msItem.title: Sententiae
msItem.note: IV. 50.3–7, pr. Quaracchi 1916, II. 1035–8.

msItem.title: Commentary on Petrus Lombardus, Sententiae
msItem.note: IV.7

msItem.author: Thomas Aquinas
msItem.title: Summa theologiae
msItem.note: la 2ae q.14 a.1– 15.a.3, numbered 82–88, pr. Turin 1948, II. 71–76

msItem.title: Theological works
msItem.note: (fragments)

history.provenance: Fol. 46 from a New College book, with bookplate of 1702 & shelfmarks 0.28.6, M.28.5, Auct.11 T.34.5

msItem.title: Glossary
msItem.note: in Latin with some Anglo-Saxon glosses, from the same manuscript as B.M. Harl. 3376

msItem.author: Osbern of Gloucester
msItem.title: Derivationes
msItem.note: copia-contemplari (with short version of repetitiones) pr. Classicorum auctorum e Vaticanis codicibus editorum, ed. A. Mai, Rome, 1836, VIII.128–36, 138–48, with marginal additions from Hugutio of Pisa, Liber derivationum, as in MS. Laud misc. 626, fols. 17v–39v.

msItem.author: Johannes Balbus de Janua
msItem.title: Catholicon
msItem.note: dicto-dilectio, pr. Lyon, 1514, fols. 6–7v

history.provenance: Labelled by Bliss

msItem.author: Geoffrey de Vinsauf
msItem.title: Poetria Nova
msItem.note: lines 1311ff. ed. Faral

history.provenance: Labelled by Bliss 'Philip Bliss 1805 from his friend Robt. Tindale. (from an old and most beautiful Copy of the Laws of the Emperor Iustinian printed at Paris by Claude Chevallon 1526'.

msItem.title: Document
msItem.note: Fragment of a letter under the Great Seal (missing) to a sheriff to right a wrong judgement 28 July 17 Eliz.I.

msItem.title: Gospel book
msItem.note: Temporale, parts of gospels for Thursday & Friday in 2nd week of Lent (Joh.5 30–47, Mat.21.33–46)

msItem.title: Gospel book or missal
msItem.note: Part of passion according to St.Luke

msItem.title: Gospel book or missal
msItem.note: Part of passion according to St. Luke 22.58, 66, with the parts marked in red.

msItem.title: Missal
msItem.note: Noted missal, temporale, parts of 14th & 15th weeks after Pentecost, with adiastematic rhythmical neums of St. Gall type

history.provenance: Bearing a 19th cent. printed label 116 (cf. items p, cc)
with later scribbles including ‘Wyllyam Horton ys boke’ and ‘1528’

msItem.title: Missal
msItem.note: Noted missal, from the common of a bishop & confessor, with square notation on staves of 4 red lines.

msPart.head: (fol.64) Kept as MS. lat. liturg. a. 8, fol. 63

msItem.title: Missal
msItem.note: Rubricated missal, part of mass of the dedication.

history.provenance: Later used as cover of a book.

msItem.title: Missal
msItem.note: Temporale, end of gospel for Friday before 4th or 5th Sunday after Pentecost (Luc.8.56), introit Respice in me, collect Protector in te, and part of gospel for same Sunday.

msItem.title: Missal
msItem.note: Sanctorale, part of mass of St.George (23 April) with part of a sequence & parts of mass for Pentecost and St. Barnabas.

msItem.title: Missal
msItem.note: Without lessons, temporale, parts of masses for Sunday of octave & for octave day of Epiphany.

history.provenance: Formerly sewn with green silk thread to fol. 70.
Formerly sewn with green silk thread to fol. 69.

msItem.title: Psalter
msItem.note: Noted ferial psalter with opening words of some antiphons in upper margins, point neum notation perhaps derived from Metz neums on staves of 4 or 5 red lines.

msItem.title: Psalter
msItem.note: Portable psalter, parts of Ps. 103.29–104.29.

history.provenance: Noted by Bliss ‘From a Catullus formerly in the Possession of Dr. Bentley = Philip Bliss 1805 from his Friend A. L. Moir.’ (cf.item A.i)

msItem.title: Psalter
msItem.note: Order of ferial psalter, Sunday hymns from Epiphany to 1st Sunday in Lent with antiphons etc. & opening words of psalms for 1st nocturn on Sundays.

msItem.title: Psalter
msItem.note: Portable psalter, parts of Ps.141.3 – 142.4, 143.14 – 144.11

msItem.title: Antiphonal
msItem.note: Temporale, some respensories etc. for matins of 3rd Sunday in Advent, antiphons etc. for Wednesday to Saturday in the same week, and the antiphon O sapientia, with Gothic notation on staves of 4 black lines.

history.provenance: Bearing a 19th cent.printed label 100 (cf.items d, cc)

msItem.title: Antiphonal
msItem.note: Temporale, last responsories of matins, lauds, little Hours & 3 antiphons of vespers for Christmas, with Gothic notation on staves of 4 black lines.

msItem.title: Hymnal
msItem.note: Hymns for week after Epiphany, for Easter, Corpus Christi and S. John Baptist.

msItem.title: Breviary
msItem.note: Noted choir breviary, temporale, part of 1st Sunday after octave of Epiphany, with adiastematic notation tending towards point-neums.

history.provenance: 18th cent. shelf mark L.i.N:40

msItem.title: Breviary
msItem.note: Noted choir breviary, sanctorale, part of matins and lauds for Purification of the Virgin (2 Feb.), with adiastematic notation in which the virga is a point-neum.

msItem.title: Breviary
msItem.note: Noted choir breviary, temporale, part of Office of Holy Trinity, & some lessons for 2nd & 3rd weeks after Pentecost, with fine square notation on staves of 4 red lines.

msItem.title: Breviary
msItem.note: Noted choir breviary, temporale, most of Passion Sunday, parts of Palm Sunday & subsequent Monday, adiastematic point neum notation with some Notker letters, secular work.

history.provenance: From the binding of a book belonging in the 18th cent. to ‘carmeli crucenacensis’ (of Kreuznach near Coblenz) marked CL:5. Lin:2. Num 35 1740; with fol. 92.

msItem.note: A narrow strip with Italian diastematic neums on a stave with red F line.

history.provenance: From the binding of a book belonging in the 18th cent. to ‘carmeli crucenacensis’ (of Kreuznach near Coblenz) marked CL:5. Lin:2. Num 35 1740; with fol. 88.

msItem.title: Breviary
msItem.note: Noted choir breviary, temporale, lessons from Genesis & responsories for Tuesday- Friday in the week of Septuagesima with half-diastematic neums related to the notation of Chartres.

msItem.title: Breviary
msItem.note: Noted choir breviary, lessons of I Mach. with the responsorial historia Adaperiat, & parts of 14th & 15th Sundays after Pentecost, adiastematic point-neum notation.

supportDesc.extent: part of a bifolium and 2 small scraps

msItem.title: Breviary, Use of Sarum
msItem.note: Rubricated & noted choir breviary, sanctorale, part of feast of 11,000 virgins (21 Oct.), Offices of SS.Simon & Jude (28 Oct.) & St.Quintinus (31 Oct.), 1st vespers, compline & 2 nocturns of All Saints (1 Nov.), with collects added for St.Romanus & SS.Crispinus & Crispinianus (23 & 25 Oct.), square notation on staves of 4 red lines.

history.provenance: Probably from an Oxford binding

msItem.title: Breviary, Use of Sarum
msItem.note: Noted choir breviary, part of Lenten litany & its variations for each day of the week, with music on 4 red lines not filled in.

history.provenance: Probably from an Oxford binding

msItem.title: Breviary
msItem.note: Choir breviary, temporale, lessons for matins of 4th & 5th days in octave of Epiphany, secular work.

history.provenance: Used later as a cover; marked in 19th cent. 6013

msItem.title: Breviary
msItem.note: Choir breviary, sanctorale, parts of Offices of St.Peter and Visitation of the Virgin with marginal notes, palimpsest, monastic work.

msItem.title: Breviary
msItem.note: Portable breviary, sanctorale, parts of proper Offices of St. Agatha (5 Feb.), St. Matthias patronus (24 Feb.), St.Gregory (12 Mar.), without title, indications for antiphons responseries or versicles, opening words of psalms, or lessons.

history.provenance: 19th cent. printed label 69 (cf.items d, p)

msItem.title: Breviary
msItem.note: Portable breviary, Common of the Saints, lessons 2–4 & responsories at matins for the evangelists, monastic (?) work .

msItem.title: Breviary
msItem.note: Portable breviary (?), temporale, last lessons & responsories (Sicut ovis, Agnus dei Christus) of matins, lauds etc. of Holy Saturday.

msItem.title: Martyrology
msItem.note: (1–8 and 25–30 March)

history.provenance: Probably from an Oxford binding.

msItem.title: Martyrology
msItem.note: (eulogies of 10–12 Feb.)

decoDesc.decoNote: Initials illuminated in blue, red & gold.

msItem.author: Justinian
msItem.title: Digest
msItem.note: VIII.6.6 – IX.1.5 with some Accursian glosses.

msItem.author: Justinian
msItem.title: Digest
msItem.note: XIX. 2.60–61, 4.1, 5.4–5 with Accursian glosses.

msPart.head: Kept as MS. Lat. Misc. a. 2, fols. 26–7

msItem.author: Justinian
msItem.title: Codex
msItem.note: IV.38.13 – 44.2 with a few Accursian glosses & other notes.

msItem.author: Gratian
msItem.title: Decretum
msItem.note: pt.II VIII.1.17 – 3.1, X.1.12 – 3.2, with some glosses

msItem.author: Gregory IX
msItem.title: Decretales
msItem.note: I 6.28, 30, with glossa ordinania.

msItem.author: Gregory IX
msItem.title: Decretales
msItem.note: IV 18.1 – 19.1, with glossa ordinaria.

msItem.title: Clementines
msItem.note: II.11.2–12.2 with glossa ordinaria on II. 12.3

msItem.title: De appellationibus
msItem.note: Part of a work; quoting Decret.II 2.6 and Decretal.I 29, II 28 but no commentators

msItem.title: Year Book of 9 Ed.III
msItem.note: Parts of Hilary & Trinity terms pr. London 1596 (Beale, Bibliography no. R.3) fol.333–334v, 343v–345
Unidentified work
